intro: Lonchocarpus mollis, commonly known as the slender legume, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many leguminous plants known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces small, clustered pods that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, edible aril. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are often hairy and have a distinctive shape. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
